data.title: Nobel Laureate Physics Strutt John 1904 – Ganga Library, Inc.
data.text:
Name: Lord Rayleigh (John William Strutt)

Birth: 12 November 1842, Langford Grove, Maldon, Essex, United Kingdom

Death: 30 June 1919, United Kingdom

Affiliation at the time of the award: Royal Institution of Great Britain, London, United Kingdom

Prize motivation: “for his investigations of the densities of the most important gases and for his discovery of argon in connection with these studies.”

Portion of Cash: 1/1

“for his investigations of the densities of the most important gases and for his discovery of argon in connection with these studies.”

Nobel Medal Cash and Charity

Lord Rayleigh (John William Strutt) donated his Nobel Prize money to Cambridge University for extending the Cavendish laboratory.
